Reason: The configuration option 'tombstone_warn_threshold' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it determines the threshold at which warning messages are generated for tombstones in the database. A lower threshold can lead to increased tombstone warnings, which can impact read performance by increasing the time taken to process queries due to the need to filter out tombstones. On the other hand, a higher threshold can lead to potential data consistency issues and increased memory consumption. Therefore, changes in the 'tombstone_warn_threshold' value can significantly affect system performance in terms of execution time and memory consumption.
